page.title: 13Religions in Ilford
page.content: This area of Ilford is blessed with {many established religious faiths.}To the north of the D block, are a group of large Anglican and Roman Catholic churches while to the south and west among the more tightly packed terraced houses, the churches are smaller and mostly free-church. In the 193O's, the influence of a powerful{Jewish community spread in from the north of the block. More recently, since 197O, many{Asian}peoples have moved into the cheaper housing around the High Road and have set up their{Hindu, Moslem and{Sikh}centres of worship. A smaller {West Indian}have successfully joined with{Christian Churches}such as the Baptists. The nearby Loxford High School often stages a very popular "International Evening" in which local yet foreign, cultures take a full part. ** B.E.L. Loxford High School.**
